text: Hello Eirimas, happy new year! I've but away the past couple of weeks enjoying some time with my family and away from my PC haha so sorry for not replying in that time. I hope you're well rested for the new semester. It's looking good so far! I'll focus on the FX part and say for the editing itself, perhaps show your render first before adding the reference footage. I think it is a little bit long and maybe you only need to include a thumbnail of it instead of it on the whole screen. Also it'd be cool for you to expand your work into adding new components like a plate taken from real-life footage and some house destruction. It reminded me of this project I saw on fxphd <https://www.fxphd.com/details/491/> if that may give you some inspiration :slightly_smiling_face: Really great work so far, hope this semester is more exciting for you with the FX work!

attachments.title: Tornado Destruction Project, Part 1 | fxphd
attachments.text: This is a two-part course and aims to complete a complex visual effects scene, starting from the effects plate all the way to the tweaks of the final comp. Based upon a suggestion from an fxphd member, the course will start with the clean plate, add a remote mountain town, and then build a CG Tornado to destroy it. Numerous applications will be used throughout the course, including 3D Equalizer, Maya, Houdini, Arnold Renderer, and NUKE.
attachments.fallback: fxphd: Tornado Destruction Project, Part 1 | fxphd
